name: Lazarus Group Operation Blacksmith
description: TTPs used by Lazarus Group during Operation Blacksmith

techniques.comment: The Lazarus Group used Telegram bots and channels for command and control communications in Operation Blacksmith
The malware sets up persistence for a component using a BAT script
The Lazarus group employed three new DLang-based malware families, two of which were RATs namely NineRAT and DLRAT
The Lazarus group, during their initial reconnaissance phase, used several commands to gather information about the system such as 'whoami', 'ver', 'getmac', etc
The Lazarus group used an exploit for CVE-2021-44228 (Log4Shell) as a mean of initial access to vulnerable public-facing servers
Lazarus group used tasklist command for software discovery
Lazarus Group used process dumping to harvest system credentials using tools such as Procdump and Mimikatz
The threat actors created an additional user account on the system, granting it administrative privileges. This TTP was reported by Microsoft
Lazarus Group made extensive use of the command-line interface for executing commands
Lazarus Group queried the Windows Registry for information
Lazarus Group modified the windows registry
Lazarus Group DLRAT malware deletes itself from the system using a BAT file
